data.title: Very cool small and cozy place in downtown for coffee, beer and bites
data.text: I dig this place. It's small, but intimate. The owner and staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcomed. The coffee, beer and food is all world class. I recommend checking it out.

data.title: Addictive - Bee Sting & Brad
data.text:
Sheryl Crow said it so well:  "The first cut is the deepest."  However, in my case I wasn't cut, but stung.  I never knew something could hurt so good.

Handsome owner, Brad, sent me into Anaphylactic Shock with his Bee Sting and I absolutely mean that in a good way.  Since being stung by this barrister's bite, I have been afflicted with experiencing sudden & severe, multiple weekly work-threatening attacks yearning for a hot & steamy, (literally - I like mine with steamed milk) pure honey laden cup of desire.  Brad artistically eclipses my experience with a creamy flowering  image & then ... "Cheers".  Now, if you'll excuse me, I must freshen up (Fifty Shades of - hey, hey, hey).

Oh, did I mention Flow has an awesome Reuben sandwich (yummmmy!), musical entertainment and artists' featured paintings & photos.  I adore that actual vinyl albums play and there's always a water bowl on the patio for the 4-legged loves of our lives.
Check out Flow and Brad.  
P.S.  You might want to take along an Epipen of sorts.  Just say'in...

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: We went looking for a starbucks and lucked out finding this place.  The owner was there and made our lattes and espressos and they were delicious!  Don't pass this up for Starbucks.  This was amazing

data.title: Really tasty coffee!
data.text: Nice, small shop with excellent coffee brewing.  I had a "bee sting," espresso / honey and a scone, both were first rate.

data.title: It's Not Starbucks
data.text:
As a Seatteite I have about 8-10 Starbucks a week. They're great because it is on the way to work. Flow a Brew Parlor is not a drink; it's an experience. A small space, mostly done in dark, flat gunmetal paint, it saves itself with floor to ceiling windows on two sides. There are only spaces for about 8 people (any more and you'd be uncomfortably close)...hence the 4 star rating. It had a coffee house vibe. I expected someone to start snapping their fingers and giving us a poem.

The latte that I chose had an intense bite, not very much foam, but the after-bite was great! My husband had a drink (we are not sure what) but he said the flavors were strong and flavorful.

data.title: Best Coffee in town
data.text:
This is a charming little hideaway that serves wonderful coffee (fresh ground and beautiful designs), beer and sweets plus gourmet sandwiches.
I had a latte and a wonderful cranberry scone when I was there. I wasn't really hungry, but noticed the beautiful looking sandwiches on baquettes and thought of taking one home with me. I will next time.
The place is very cozy and comfy and has an outdoor eating are, also.
Just delightful.
I would put this little eatery in with the BEST of Knoxville, because it reminds me of little bistros in Europe or NYC.

data.title: Local and great! Serves "Counter Culture" Coffee
data.text: A neat little place in the heart of downtown. Not just coffee ("Counter Culture brand) but lunch and desserts too. Brad the owner is supre nice and will likely be taking care of you on your visit.

data.title: New business with diversity
data.text: This relatively new business that opened in December has an interesting concept. The menu mainly consists of very good coffee, unique beer offerings, pastries, and chili. Yes, I would say they have breakfast, brunch, and lunch covered. I very much enjoyed the interior surroundings and what I sampled for munchies and beverage as well. A very nice addition to downtown Knoxville.
